= Packages =

Only for arch
{{{bash
sudo pacman -S cronie
}}}


= Creating cron jobs =

To edit cronjobs, run the following command
{{{bash
crontab -e
}}}

That will edit a file with contents like the following:

{{{crontab
* * * * * /usr/bin/mpc update
*/15 * * * * /usr/bin/newsboat -x reload
}}}

== Reading config file ==

The `*`'s indicate how many times that script should be run. 
{{{crontab
* * * * * /usr/bin/mpc update
*/15 * * * 1-5 /usr/bin/newsboat -x reload
0,15,30,45 * * * * ***REMOVED***/.scripts/datelog
@reboot ***REMOVED***/software/app-images/Obsidian-0.13.23.AppImage
MIN HOUR DAY MONTH DoW
}}}

* `mpc` update is run every minute 
* `newsboat -x reload` is run 
    * every 15 minutes 
    * Monday through Friday
* `datelog` is also run every 15 minutes
* Obsidian is run every reboot

= Misc =

* root crontab jobs can be found with
{{{bash
sudo crontab -e
}}} 

* the / operator
    * The / operator indicates "the value before the slash plus a multiple of the number after"
        * `*/2` for months means 1,3,5,7,9,11 


== Enabling cronjobs ==

For system-d users:

{{{bash
systemctl enable cronie.service
systemctl start cronie.service
}}}
